front.title: An End-to-End Session Layer for Realm-Specific Networking

abstract.t: Application- and transport-layer gateways are consideredharmful to the Internet since they hinder the operation ofexisting and new end-to-end protocols. A survey of suchupper-level gateways shows that they exist because ofrealm-specific performance, security, and protocol needs ofcertain portions of the Internet. Expecting thisrealm-specific functionality to be added manually deployted toevery end hosts or application is, conversely, harmful to theflexibility of using the Internet to link disparate networks.
